A handy guide to exploring the moon’s schedule on this special Friday, October 10, 2025.
The moon on Karwa Chauth often rises late, a result of its graceful cosmic rhythm. This delay stems from its orbital path, position in the sky, and Earth's location.
Karwa Chauth occurs on the fourth day (Chaturthi) of the Krishna Paksha, the moon's waning phase. As it’s just four days after the full moon, moonrise happens later in the evening.
The moon rises about 50 minutes later daily, so by the fourth waning night, moonrise shifts well beyond its full moon timing.
Your exact spot on Earth—its latitude and longitude—dictates when the moon rises, causing times to vary between cities.
